channel.title: If(wait(1000))then
channel.description:
Hello,
I want to make a clock. One problem. I don't know how to start ;)
I want something that works like what's in the title. It waits a certain amount of time, and preforms a command.
Please help,
Mike.

item.title: If(wait(1000))then
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

Wow. over 11k car crashes un-named. hmmm… what else should i put in this post so it isnt spam… what to do, what to do. I know! ill talk about some random crap car insurance commercials like the all-state ones with that accident forgiveness stuff cause thats the one where they say the statistic about the crashes. no, thats too obvious. i should probably just get back to playing FlyFF… my acro really needs to get to lv40… or maybe i should play my merc? nah. anyway, i dont know what i should say to keep this from being spam, so ill just post it. post wtf why hasnt it gone up yet? come on… hurry up… maybe i should click it again. post nah that didnt work either. OH! i was just hitting preview! post ok. thats better. ONWARD TO FLYFF!!

Read full topic

item.title: If(wait(1000))then
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“gokon, post:4, topic:54453”]here’s a little more depressing version of the clock. it also includes hours and minutes.

[code]program Clock;

var
times, timem, timeh, ccrash : integer;

procedure count;
begin
Wait(1000);
times := times + 1;
timem := times / 60
timeh := timem / 60
ccrash := times / 5
ClearDebug;
Writeln( IntToStr(times) + ’ seconds have passed since script start!’)
Writeln( IntToStr(timem) + ’ minutes have passed since script start!’)
Writeln( IntToStr(timeh) + ’ hours have passed since script start!’)
Writeln( IntToStr(ccrash) + ’ car crashes have occurred since script start!’)
end;

begin
repeat
count
until(false)
end.[/code]
and yes, it is a fact that in the United States a car crash happens every 5 seconds(on average)[/quote]

I left that running all day. forgot to close it.

55267 seconds have passed since script start!
921 minutes have passed since script start!
15 hours have passed since script start!
11053 car crashes have occurred since script start!
Successfully executed

Read full topic

item.title: If(wait(1000))then
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

here’s a little more depressing version of the clock. it also includes hours and minutes.

[code]program Clock;

var
times, timem, timeh, ccrash : integer;

procedure count;
begin
Wait(1000);
times := times + 1;
timem := times / 60
timeh := timem / 60
ccrash := times / 5
ClearDebug;
Writeln( IntToStr(times) + ’ seconds have passed since script start!’)
Writeln( IntToStr(timem) + ’ minutes have passed since script start!’)
Writeln( IntToStr(timeh) + ’ hours have passed since script start!’)
Writeln( IntToStr(ccrash) + ’ car crashes have occurred since script start!’)
end;

begin
repeat
count
until(false)
end.[/code]
and yes, it is a fact that in the United States a car crash happens every 5 seconds(on average)

Read full topic

item.title: If(wait(1000))then
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

I made a fast example for you, should work.

program Clock;

var
times : integer;

procedure count;
begin
       Wait(1000);
       times := times + 1;
       ClearDebug;
       Writeln( IntToStr(times) + ' seconds have passed since script start!')
end;

begin
   repeat
      count
   until(false)
end.

If you want to make countdown like script you just define until command.
Here is countdowner that counts to 5 and does its job.

[code]
program countdown;

var
times : integer;

procedure Letsdefinehowlongtocount;
begin
times := 5 //here you can define how many times to count.
end;

procedure count;
begin
Wait(1000);
times := times -1;
ClearDebug;
Writeln( IntToStr(times) + ’ seconds left! RUN!’)
end;

begin
Letsdefinehowlongtocount;
repeat
count
until(times = 0)
ClearDebug;
Writeln(‘Earth has been destroyed!’);
end.[/code]

Read full topic
